identity.nature: A rival bodhisattva—a being who has been working toward full Buddhahood across countless lifetimes, now very close to achieving it
identity.origin: Ancient soul on the path to enlightenment; became aware of Silas as a threat when she sensed another consciousness approaching stream-entry in the same world-system
identity.cosmic_constraint: Only one fully enlightened Buddha can exist in any given world-system at a time; if Silas achieves Buddhahood first, Lilith's eons of work are nullified

motivation.surface: In her current incarnation as psychiatrist Lilith Azami, she may rationalize her actions as 'helping' Silas or 'testing' him
motivation.true: Desperate self-preservation of her path to enlightenment; she must derail Silas before he achieves what she has worked lifetimes to attain
motivation.relationship_to_silas: Rival, not enemy—she doesn't hate him, but his success means her failure. This may include complex feelings: respect for a fellow traveler, resentment at the cosmic unfairness, perhaps even attraction to the very qualities that make him a threat
motivation.tragic_irony: Her grasping at Buddhahood—the very desperation driving her interference—is itself the attachment that prevents her enlightenment. She cannot see that releasing her claim would free her.

power_progression.capabilities: Can see Silas's current and recent past lives through meditation/intimate connection
power_progression.limitations: Cannot act on past, only observe

power_progression.objective_this_chapter: None yet—this is when she first becomes aware of Silas's soul. She observes Ka and realizes this consciousness is accumulating merit at an alarming rate. The observation itself may inadvertently influence events.

power_progression.capabilities: Can influence trusted colleague Devaka's betrayal, compromises investigation
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: First deliberate interference—sabotage Chandra's development of true generosity by corrupting his trusted relationships. If he cannot trust, he cannot give of himself. The betrayal is meant to harden him.
power_progression.emotional_state: Calculating, still confident she can redirect his path

power_progression.limitations: Suggestions only, not commands; dream logic applies
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Corrupt his understanding of altruism by planting dreams that conflate selflessness with self-destruction. Make him believe true altruism requires martyrdom—a subtle poison that will distort his path.
power_progression.emotional_state: Methodical; treating this as a long-term project

power_progression.capabilities: Can subtly manipulate circumstances and minor characters
power_progression.limitations: Cannot affect Silas directly; changes must be plausible
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Test his commitment to virtue by engineering moral dilemmas with no clean answers. Present him with situations where every choice involves complicity in harm. A Stoic who loses faith in ethical clarity is easier to derail.
power_progression.emotional_state: Growing frustration—her earlier interventions haven't slowed his progress

power_progression.capabilities: Stronger ability to influence events and people
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Twist his renunciation into spiritual pride. A hermit who believes his asceticism makes him superior has traded one attachment for another. She works to make him attached to being unattached.
power_progression.emotional_state: Anxious; his progress continues despite her efforts

power_progression.capabilities: Can appear momentarily in past lives
power_progression.limitations: Appearances brief, draining; cannot sustain presence
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Her first physical appearance—she manifests as an object of desire, attempting to bind him through sensual attachment. The Heian court's aesthetic obsession with beauty makes this the ideal battleground. If she can make him crave her across lifetimes, she wins.
power_progression.emotional_state: A new strategy; perhaps something personal is emerging

power_progression.capabilities: More sustained physical presence in past
power_progression.limitations: Still time-limited; appearance may be unstable
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Cultivate his hatred. The Inquisition provides the perfect crucible—if she can make him hate his persecutors deeply enough, ill-will becomes a fetter he cannot break. She may appear as an inquisitor, or as a fellow victim who urges vengeance.
power_progression.emotional_state: Desperate measures; willing to cause him suffering

power_progression.capabilities: Can engage in extended interactions with past incarnations
power_progression.limitations: Silas does not recognize her across lives
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Feed his doubt. The Renaissance skeptic is already questioning—she appears as a philosophical companion who encourages radical doubt that extends to the spiritual path itself. If he stops believing enlightenment is possible, he stops pursuing it.
power_progression.emotional_state: Intellectually engaged; this is a battle of ideas she thinks she can win

power_progression.capabilities: Extended physical presence, direct confrontations possible
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Make his self-sacrifice meaningless. In the chaos of the Taiping Rebellion, she works to ensure that everyone he tries to save dies anyway. If self-sacrifice achieves nothing, he may abandon the path of helping others entirely.
power_progression.emotional_state: Ruthless; the stakes justify any action

power_progression.capabilities: Can fully interact, attempting to prevent stream-entry
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Break his perseverance directly. The noir detective faces overwhelming obstacles—she ensures every case fails, every client betrays him, every victory turns to ash. This is her last chance before the present day. She throws everything she has at breaking his spirit.
power_progression.emotional_state: Panic beneath control; she can feel him approaching stream-entry

power_progression.capabilities: Can appear completely in present timeline, all powers at peak in human realm
power_progression.limitations: Direct confrontation; Silas can now perceive her fully
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Final desperate gambit. She manifests fully as Lilith Azami, the psychiatrist who has become intimate with Silas. She has one last chance to prevent his stream-entry—through love, through fear, through any means necessary. The irony: her desperation is visible to him now, and witnessing her attachment may be exactly what helps him release his own.
power_progression.emotional_state: All masks dropped; raw desperation, perhaps love, certainly attachment

power_progression.capabilities: Powers amplified in higher dimensional space
power_progression.limitations: Celestial realm has its own rules
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: She has failed to prevent stream-entry but not Buddhahood. New strategy: if she cannot stop him, perhaps she can race him. The celestial realm amplifies both their capabilities—she pursues her own accelerated path while still attempting to slow his.
power_progression.emotional_state: Recalibrating; grief at her failure mixed with renewed determination

power_progression.capabilities: Can affect larger systems and timelines
power_progression.limitations: Silas's progress makes him harder to divert
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: The race intensifies. As Silas progresses toward once-returner status, Lilith works on a cosmic scale to create distractions, temptations, attachments—anything to slow him while she catches up. The future Earth setting allows technological temptations: what if enlightenment could be achieved through technology rather than renunciation?
power_progression.emotional_state: Manic focus; this is now a sprint

power_progression.limitations: Non-returner status places Silas beyond certain influences
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: As Silas achieves non-returner status, he becomes nearly immune to her direct interference. Her cosmic horror: she can manipulate nearly everything, but not the one thing that matters. Desperation gives way to something else—perhaps the beginning of acceptance, or perhaps one final terrible gambit.
power_progression.emotional_state: The edge of transformation; her own attachments becoming unbearable

power_progression.capabilities: Either achieves enlightenment herself or transcends need for competition
power_progression.objective_this_chapter: Resolution. Possible endings: (1) Silas's enlightenment somehow creates space for hers—the 'one Buddha' rule is transcended or revealed as misunderstood; (2) Witnessing his release, she finally releases her own grasping and achieves enlightenment in the same moment; (3) She remains trapped by her attachment, a tragic figure who had everything except the ability to let go; (4) Something stranger—their consciousnesses merge, revealing they were aspects of the same being all along.

arc_summary.chapters_2_6: Indirect interference—working through circumstances, dreams, intermediaries to corrupt his development of the perfections
arc_summary.chapters_7_11: Increasingly direct confrontation—physical manifestations, sustained presence, desperate measures as she realizes he cannot be easily derailed
arc_summary.chapter_12: All-or-nothing gambit in the present day; intimate relationship as final weapon
arc_summary.chapters_13_15: Post-failure recalibration; the race to Buddhahood rather than prevention of his progress
arc_summary.chapter_16: Resolution of the central question: can two beings compete for enlightenment, or does the competition itself prevent it?

key_questions_resolved: What is Lilith's true nature? A rival bodhisattva, very close to enlightenment, who sees Silas as an existential threat.
Why does she oppose Silas's enlightenment specifically? The one-Buddha-per-world-system rule means his success nullifies her eons of work.
Does she have her own spiritual progression? Yes—she's further along than almost any being, which is why she can manipulate reality. But her attachment to achieving Buddhahood is itself the obstacle.
questions_still_open: What is the resolution—mutual enlightenment, her defeat, her transformation, merger?
Does she appear as the same person across lives, or different people?
Does Silas ever recognize her across incarnations before Chapter 12?
What is the exact nature of their relationship in the present day? Lovers? Patient/therapist? Something else?
